name: Court Appointed Special Advocate
description: CASA of Clay, Knox and Laurel Counties provides trained volunteer advocates for abused and neglected children in the court system. Volunteers are appointed by judges to represent the best interests of children, ensuring they have a stable and constant advocate throughout their case until placed in a safe, permanent home.
source: Verified from official website, Google search results, and business listing
eligibility_requirements: Volunteers must complete application process and background check. Services available to children in abuse and neglect cases.
populations_served: Abused and neglected children in Clay, Knox, and Laurel Counties
cost_information: Free services for children. Volunteer training and support provided at no cost.
notes: VERIFIED INFORMATION: All contact information verified on 2025-01-15. CITATIONS: Contact information verified from official website (https://casacumberlandvalley.com/). Phone number and address confirmed through Google search results and business listing. Hours of operation confirmed from Google business listing showing 'Opens 9 AM Thu'. CASA services and volunteer requirements verified from website content. 501(c)3 non-profit organization status confirmed. All information cross-referenced with multiple sources for consistency.
